intro: Biscutella didyma var. gymnocarpa, commonly known as the smooth-seeded biscuitroot, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other well-known flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and hairy stems, typically growing in rocky or sandy soils. It produces capsule fruits that contain small, hard seeds. This variety is distinguished by its smooth, non-glandular fruits, which set it apart from other varieties within the species.
